text:
This is how a pils should be. No frills, just a good, drinkable beer.

Golden body with a good white hea. Aroma is grass, taste is bitter/grassy, lively carbonation.

You can drink liters of it and still not get bored.

(Draught at Beer Geek Bar, Prague, 25 July 2015) Pale golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, hoppy nose with notes of bread, citrus and grass. Malty taste with citrus, grass, bread, hay and a balanced grassy bitterness in the finish. Solid and well made, but a bit middle-of-the-roadish for a Matuska beer. Quite nice.
Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma - Hops, grass, fruit. Taste - Dry, hops, biscuit.
Golden colour, white head. Aroma of Saaz hops, malts. Taste is light bitter, slightly sweet. Very well balanced. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation. One of the best Pilsners I´ve had.

Dunkelgelb, leicht trüb mit schöner Blume, relativ wenig Kohlensäure. Blumiges, reifes Hopfenaroma. Beginnt malzig-lieblich bevor der aromatische Hopfen gegen Mitte immer mehr anzieht. Ausgewogen und sehr süffig.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou ádně "dojmy" .

On tap in Pilsen. Matuska strikes again! Another excellent, excellent beer. Beautiful golden colour, aroma is clean, grassy, hoppy, chewy and doughy. Are these guys even capable of making a bad beer!?

Drafted at Klub Malych pivovaru in Pilsen.A hazy golden color with a foamy white head.Aroma of floral,grass with flavors of, fruity hops,malt and grass.Very crisp with a bit of sugary sweetness and a dry carbonated finish.

on tap at zly casy and klub malych pivovaru. beautiful golden with a slight haze and a persistent head; juicy aroma of grass, menthol and chewing gum; delicious doughy malts and a rasping bitter finish. more great drinking from a brewery that never seems to put a foot wrong

Tap @ Jama, Prague. Pours unclear yellow with a creamy white head and lacings. Nose and taste is dry, grassy, floral and overall very hoppy. Crisp and dry flavor with plenty of hops and a bit of buiscuit. Very quaffable

Draught @ GBBF 09, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England. [ As Matuka Pils ]. Clear light to medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, moderate hoppy, green grass. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20090804]

A Mes rate: Keg at GBBF.Beautifully clean yellow gold with a superb lasting white head. This was an unfiltered version if that means anything. Just an amazing bit of Czech hoppage. Faint biscuity malt, loads of dry grassy notes and a really clean finish. Surrounded by run of the mill British stuff on the table, this was the only thing I wanted to drink at that point. So bloody drinkable I had to go back and get some more. Had a good chat with the brewer who was a really nice chap and he ended up giving me a free half and a Bernard glass. Nice one mate!
Slightly hazy golden with a lasting white head. Biscuit malty aroma with hints of grass and fruit. Sweet and fruity malt flavour
Cask at GBBF 2009 ...  ( as Pat :-} )  ... gold yellow ... light grassy hop nose ... light sweet fruit ... vey grassy

Pale golden colour, small white head. Aroma is vegetably, sweet malty as well as some grassy hopping. Flavour is caramel malts, some earth, grassyness and also mild notes of yeast.

Slightly hazy yellow, small white head. Sweetish malty, hoppy aroma. Sweet malts, Saaz hops and rubber in the flavor. Typical unfiletered Czech pils, quite sweet. Ok.

On tap at Zlý Časy beer festival. Well balanced pilsener with a nice variety throughout from start to finish. Sweetness at the start that feels more subbstantial in the middle, and leaves a lingering pleasantness at the finish. Couldnt really identify any of the flavours though.

draught at Zly Casy Beer Festival 2009. This is a beer brewed at Strahovs Martin Matuskas brand new brewery in Broumy. Amber colour (although called svetly, it looks like a good polotmavy), hazy, large off-white head that is very creamy. Malty start with a lot of honey. Very hoppy in the middle and the lingering dry finish. Superb.
